text: Abbyville is a city in Reno County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 83 people lived there. ==History== Abbyville was a station on the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway. The town was named after Abby McLean, the first baby born there. The first post office in Abbyville was created in 1886. It was moved from Salt Creek. ==Geography== Abbyville is at (37.970576, -98.202961). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of 0.27 square miles (0.69 km2). All of it is land. ===Weather=== Abbyville has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system, Abbyville has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Abbyville, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 83 people, 42 households, and 32 families living in Abbyville. Of the households, 90.5% owned their home and 9.5% rented their home. The median age was 61.3. Of the people, 95.2% were White, 1.2% were Native American, 2.4% were from some other race, and 1.2% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino were 2.4% of the population. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 87 people, 42 households, and 29 families living in Abbyville. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Abbyville - Directory of Public Officials ;Business * Abbyville CO-OP ;Schools * USD 310, local school district ;Maps * Abbyville City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Reno County, Kansas Category:Cities in Kansas
title: Abbyville, Kansas
